info.title: LeakRadar.io API
info.description:
Easily interact with the LeakRadar.io platform via its public API.

    • Endpoint: https://api.leakradar.io  
    • Python 3 wrapper: https://github.com/LeakRadar/leakradar-wrapper  

    API key: generate yours from the dashboard (paid plan required)  
    https://members.leakradar.io/settings?tab=api-key  

    Rate limits: 30 requests per second

get.description: Search leaked password hashes (SHA-1) by prefix or full hash and get the distinct matches with their occurrence counts

parameters.name: prefix

schema.description: SHA-1 prefix or full hash to search for.
schema.title: Prefix

parameters.description: SHA-1 prefix or full hash to search for.

parameters.name: limit

schema.description: Maximum number of matching hashes to return.
schema.title: Limit

parameters.description: Maximum number of matching hashes to return.

parameters.name: suffix_only

schema.description: If true, return only hash suffixes (after the first 5 chars) instead of full hashes.
schema.title: Suffix Only

parameters.description: If true, return only hash suffixes (after the first 5 chars) instead of full hashes.

post.summary: Search leaks with advanced filters (JSON body)
post.description:
Search leaked credentials using any combination of fields defined in `LeakSearchFilters`.

Pagination: page>=1, page_size in [1,1000].
If your plan includes `advanced_search`, full URLs and item IDs are returned; otherwise redacted.
Identical requests may be cached for up to 1 hour.

schema.description: Advanced search filters.

post.summary: Unlock leaks for advanced search
post.description:
Unlock leaks returned by the same advanced search filters as `/search/advanced`. Provide filters in the JSON body. Optional query parameter `max` limits how many new leaks to unlock.

**Behavior**
- If `max` is omitted, the service unlocks as many as your available points allow (subscription + extra).
- Only previously locked items are unlocked. Already unlocked items remain unchanged.
- Only newly unlocked items consume points.
- **Hard cap**: synchronous unlocks are limited to 10,000. Use `/search/advanced/unlock/task` for higher volumes.

**Plan requirement**
Requires a paid plan with `advanced_search` enabled.

**Errors**
- 400 No data found for these filters.
- 400 All data already unlocked.
- 400 Insufficient points.
- 400 Too many unlocks for synchronous endpoint (>10k).
- 403 Advanced search is not available on your plan.

parameters.name: max

schema.description: 0 or omitted = use all your points
schema.title: Max

parameters.description: 0 or omitted = use all your points

parameters.name: list_id

schema.description: Assign this list id to new unlocks.
schema.title: List Id

parameters.description: Assign this list id to new unlocks.

schema.title: Response Unlock All Advanced Leaks Search Advanced Unlock Post

post.summary: Queue an async mass unlock task for advanced search
post.description: Creates an asynchronous unlock **Task** for the given advanced filters. Returns a `task_id` you can poll with the task-status endpoint.

parameters.name: max

schema.description: Optional cap of new unlocks.
schema.title: Max

parameters.description: Optional cap of new unlocks.

parameters.name: list_id

schema.description: Assign this list id to new unlocks.
schema.title: List Id

parameters.description: Assign this list id to new unlocks.

schema.description: Filters to apply to the advanced search.

schema.title: Response Queue Advanced Unlock Task Search Advanced Unlock Task Post

post.summary: Export leaks to CSV/TXT/JSON
post.description:
Queue an export of all leaks that match the provided advanced search filters. At least one filter is required.

Request body
- JSON payload following the `LeakSearchFilters` schema.

Query parameters
- `format` optional output format: `csv` (default), `txt`, or `json`.

Limits and plan requirement
- You can have at most 5 exports with status PENDING or IN_PROGRESS per account.
- Requires a paid plan with `advanced_search` enabled.

Response
`ExportResponse` with `status`, `message`, and `export_id`.

parameters.name: format

schema.description: Output format: csv (default), txt, or json.

parameters.description: Output format: csv (default), txt, or json.

post.summary: Export distinct URLs to CSV/TXT/JSON
post.description:
Queue an export of all distinct URLs from leaks that match the provided advanced search filters. Provide the filters in the JSON request body.

Request body
- `filters` payload following `LeakSearchFilters` fields.

Query parameters
- `format` optional output format: `csv` (default), `txt`, or `json`.

Limits and plan requirement
- At least one filter is required.
- You can have at most 1 export with status PENDING or IN_PROGRESS per account.
- Requires a paid plan with `advanced_search` enabled.

Response
`ExportResponse` with `status`, `message`, and `export_id`.

parameters.name: format

schema.description: Output format: csv (default), txt, or json.

parameters.description: Output format: csv (default), txt, or json.

get.summary: List leaks for customers of a domain
get.description:
Return a paginated list of leaks linked to customers of the given domain.

**Query parameters**
- `page` starts at 1.
- `page_size` is 1 to 1000 (default 100).
- `search` optional term to narrow results.
- `is_email` optional boolean to filter emails (true), usernames (false), or both (null).

**Access and visibility**
- If your plan includes `domain_search`, full URLs and item IDs are returned.
- Otherwise URLs are redacted except for the first 10 items per page and IDs are omitted.
- Credentials are included only for items with `unlocked=true` and if your plan includes `domain_search`.

**Response**
`PaginatedLeaksResponse` with `items`, `total`, `total_unlocked`, `page`, `page_size`.

**Caching**
Identical requests may be cached for up to 1 hour.

parameters.name: page

schema.description: Page number.
schema.title: Page

parameters.description: Page number.

parameters.name: page_size

schema.description: Number of results per page.
schema.title: Page Size

parameters.description: Number of results per page.

parameters.name: search

schema.description: Optional search term to filter results.
schema.title: Search

parameters.description: Optional search term to filter results.

Identical requests may be cached for up to 1 hour.

get.summary: Get leak report for a domain
get.description:
Return a domain leak report. If unauthenticated, `light=true` is forced.

**Modes**
- `light=true`: returns sampled counts only.
- `light=false` (authenticated): returns exact counts plus password stats per group.

**Caching**
- Light up to 12 hours, full up to 1 hour.

schema.title: Response Search Domain Leaks Search Domain  Domain  Get

get.description:
Generate and download a PDF report for the given domain.

**Content**
- Aggregated counts for compromised employees, third parties, and customers.
- Aggregated password statistics per group when available.

**Caching and errors**
- Identical requests may be cached for up to 1 hour.
- 400 The `domain` parameter cannot be empty.

200.description: PDF report for the requested domain.

Content-Disposition.description: Attachment filename for the PDF report.

404.description: Domain not found or no data available.

get.description:
Return a paginated list of distinct subdomains for the given domain with their occurrence counts.

**Query parameters**
- `page` starts at 1.
- `page_size` is 1 to 1000 (default 100).
- `search` optional wildcard filter on subdomain.

**Access and visibility**
- If your plan includes `domain_search`, full subdomains are returned.
- Otherwise subdomains are redacted except for the first 10 items per page. If `search` is provided and you are not entitled, results are redacted.

**Caching**
Identical requests may be cached for up to 1 hour.

post.summary: Export all subdomains for a domain as CSV/TXT/JSON
post.description:
Generate an on-demand export of all distinct subdomains for the given domain. The export contains a single `Subdomain` column.

**Plan requirement**
Requires a paid plan with `domain_search` enabled.

**Caching**
Identical requests may be cached for up to 1 hour.

**Parameters**
- You can provide `search` either as a query parameter or in the JSON body. If both are provided, the JSON body value takes precedence.

parameters.name: search

schema.description: Optional wildcard filter on subdomain when using query parameters. If also provided in the JSON body, the body value takes precedence.
schema.title: Search

parameters.description: Optional wildcard filter on subdomain when using query parameters. If also provided in the JSON body, the body value takes precedence.

parameters.name: format

schema.description: Output format: csv (default), txt, or json.

parameters.description: Output format: csv (default), txt, or json.

post.summary: Export all URLs for a domain as CSV/TXT/JSON
post.description:
Generate an on-demand export of all distinct URLs for the given domain. The export contains a single `URL` column and is capped at 100,000 rows.

**Plan requirement**
Requires a paid plan with `domain_search` enabled.

**Caching**
Identical requests may be cached for up to 1 hour.

**Parameters**
- You can provide `search` either as a query parameter or in the JSON body. If both are provided, the JSON body value takes precedence.

parameters.name: search

schema.description: Optional search term to filter results when using query parameters. If also provided in the JSON body, the body value takes precedence.

schema.description: Output format: csv (default), txt, or json.

parameters.description: Output format: csv (default), txt, or json.

post.summary: Export domain leaks to CSV/TXT/JSON
post.description:
Queue an export of all leaks for the given domain and leak type (valid values: `employees`, `customers`, `third_parties`). The job runs asynchronously and the file will appear in the Exports section when ready.

**Parameters**
- You can provide `search`, `is_email`, and `format` either as query parameters or in the JSON body. If both are provided, the JSON body values take precedence.

**Query parameters**
- `search` optional term to narrow results.
- `is_email` optional boolean to filter emails (true), usernames (false), or both (null).
- `format` optional output format: `csv` (default), `txt`, or `json`.

**Limits and plan requirement**
- You can have at most 5 exports with status PENDING or IN_PROGRESS (per account).
- Requires a paid plan with `domain_search` enabled.

**Response**
`ExportResponse` with `status`, `message`, and `export_id`.

parameters.name: search

schema.description: Optional term to narrow results when using query parameters. If also provided in the JSON body, the body value takes precedence.
schema.title: Search

parameters.description: Optional term to narrow results when using query parameters. If also provided in the JSON body, the body value takes precedence.

parameters.name: is_email

schema.description: Optional boolean to filter emails (true), usernames (false), or both (null). If also provided in the JSON body, the body value takes precedence.
schema.title: Is Email

parameters.description: Optional boolean to filter emails (true), usernames (false), or both (null). If also provided in the JSON body, the body value takes precedence.

parameters.name: format

schema.description: Output format: csv (default), txt, or json.

parameters.description: Output format: csv (default), txt, or json.

post.summary: Unlock leaks for a domain
post.description:
Unlock leaks for the given domain and leak type (valid values: `employees`, `customers`, `third_parties`). Use `max` to cap how many new leaks to unlock. The effective limit is capped by your available points.

Behavior
- Only previously locked items are unlocked. Already unlocked items are left unchanged.
- Only newly unlocked items consume points.
- **Hard cap**: synchronous unlocks are limited to 10,000. Use `/search/domain/{domain}/{leak_type}/unlock/task` for higher volumes.

Plan requirement
Requires a paid plan with `domain_search` enabled.

Errors
- 400 The `domain` parameter is required, no data found matching the criteria, insufficient points, or too many unlocks for sync (>10k).
- 403 Domain search is not available on your plan.

schema.description: Optional search term to filter results.
schema.title: Search

schema.title: Is Email

schema.description: Maximum number of leaks to unlock.
schema.title: Max

post.summary: Batch exists-check of still-locked leaks by domain and category (account-specific)
post.description: For up to 100 domains, returns per-category booleans indicating whether there are leaks that are still locked for the current account (total minus the account's unlocked items). Use include_counts=true to also get locked/total/unlocked counts.

post.summary: Search leaks by email or username
post.description:
Search for leaks associated with a specific email or username. Provide the search payload in the JSON body.

Pagination
- `page` starts at 1.
- `page_size` is 1 to 100 (default 100).

Access and visibility
- If your plan includes `email_search`, full URLs and item IDs are returned.
- Otherwise URLs are redacted except for the first 10 items per page and IDs are omitted.
- Credentials are returned only when `unlocked=true` and your plan includes `email_search`.

Response
`EmailSearchResponse` with `items`, `total`, `total_unlocked`, `page`, `page_size`.

Caching
Identical requests may be cached for up to 1 hour.

Special case: if `email` is a full SHA-1 (40 hex chars, no '@'), search is done on username_hash exactly.

post.summary: Unlock leaks for an email
post.description:
Unlock leaks for the given email or username. Provide the search payload in the JSON body. Use the `max` query parameter to cap how many new leaks to unlock. The effective limit is capped by your available points.

Request body
- `email` the email or username to search.
- `search` optional free-text filter applied to URL or username.
- `is_email` optional boolean: `true` emails only, `false` usernames only, `null` both.

Behavior
- Only previously locked items are unlocked. Already unlocked items are left unchanged.
- Only newly unlocked items consume points.
- If nothing new can be unlocked but matching unlocked items exist, those unlocked items are returned.
- **Hard cap**: synchronous unlocks are limited to 10,000. Use `/search/email/unlock/task` for higher volumes.

Plan requirement
Requires a paid plan with `email_search` enabled.

Errors
- 400 No data found for that email.
- 403 Email search is not available on your plan.

parameters.name: max

schema.description: 0 or omitted = use all your points
schema.title: Max

parameters.description: 0 or omitted = use all your points

parameters.name: list_id

schema.description: Assign this list id to new unlocks.
schema.title: List Id

parameters.description: Assign this list id to new unlocks.

schema.title: Response Unlock All Email Leaks Search Email Unlock Post

post.summary: Queue an async mass unlock task for an email
post.description:
Creates an **asynchronous** unlock Task for the given email/username + optional filters. Returns a `task_id` you can poll with the task-status endpoint.

max semantics
- Omit `max` or set `max=0` → use all your available points.
- Positive `max` → unlock up to that number (and ≤ your points).

parameters.name: max

schema.description: 0 or omitted = use all your points
schema.title: Max

parameters.description: 0 or omitted = use all your points

parameters.description: Assign this list id to new unlocks.

schema.title: Response Queue Email Unlock Task Search Email Unlock Task Post

post.summary: Export leaks for an email to CSV/TXT/JSON
post.description:
Queue an export of all leaks that match the given email or username and optional filters. Provide the search payload in the JSON body.

Request body
- `email` the email or username to search.
- `search` optional free-text filter applied to URL or username.
- `is_email` optional boolean: `true` emails only, `false` usernames only, `null` both.

Query parameters
- `format` optional output format: `csv` (default), `txt`, or `json`.

Limits and plan requirement
- You can have at most 5 exports with status PENDING or IN_PROGRESS (per account).
- Requires a paid plan with `email_search` enabled.

Response
`ExportResponse` with `status`, `message`, and `export_id`.

parameters.name: format

schema.description: Output format: csv (default), txt, or json.

parameters.description: Output format: csv (default), txt, or json.

post.summary: Batch exists-check of still-locked leaks by email (account-specific)
post.description: For up to 100 emails, returns booleans and optional counts indicating whether there are leaks that are still locked for the current account. Use include_counts=true to also get locked/total/unlocked counts.

post.summary: Search raw leak blocks
post.description:
Perform a full text search across raw leak blocks. Provide the search payload in the JSON body.

**Request body**
- `q`: Optional search string (minimum 4 characters once quotes are removed when provided).
- `container_id`: Optional container identifier.
- `exts`: Optional list of file extensions to keep.
- `exts_not`: Optional list of file extensions to exclude.
- `categories`: Optional list of raw file categories (filtered in ElasticSearch).
- `categories_not`: Optional list of raw file categories to exclude (filtered in ElasticSearch).
- `file_name`: Optional wildcard applied to `entry_name`.

- `file_name_not`: Optional wildcard that must NOT match `entry_name`.

If `q` is omitted, you must provide at least one filter among `container_id`, `exts`, `categories`, `file_name`.

**Query parameters**
- `page` starts at 1.
- `page_size` ranges from 1 to 100 (default 10).

**Response**
Uniform shape: { items, total, page, page_size }.

get.summary: List parts for a raw entry
get.description:
Return metadata about the blocks (parts) of a raw entry.

**Query parameters**
- `container_id`: Required container identifier.
- `entry_path`: Path of the entry inside the container.
- `page`/`page_size`: Classic pagination; server auto-switches to deep pagination if needed.

**Response**
Uniform shape: { items, total, page, page_size } and optional `window`.

Fetch the textual content for a specific raw entry block. If the block is not unlocked, the content is censored unless `auto_unlock=true` succeeds.

**Query parameters**
- `container_id`: Required container identifier.
- `entry_path`: Path of the entry inside the container.
- `seq`: Block sequence number (0-based).
- `trim_overlap`: When true, drop the overlapping prefix shared with the previous block.
- `overlap_chars`: Number of characters to trim when `trim_overlap=true` (default from configuration).
- `auto_unlock`: Attempt to unlock the block using points when necessary.

**Response**
Returns `PartResponse` describing the block and its (possibly censored) content.

List entries located under a given prefix within a container.

Pagination is always `page`/`page_size`. The server automatically performs deep pagination using a PIT snapshot for pages beyond the Elasticsearch result window.

Uniform response: { items, total, page, page_size }.

parameters.name: prefix

schema.description: folder prefix, ex: 'db/users' ('' = root of container)
schema.title: Prefix

parameters.description: folder prefix, ex: 'db/users' ('' = root of container)

get.description:
Aggregate the immediate subfolders located under the provided prefix.

Pagination is `page`/`page_size`. The server hides any cursor and handles deep paging internally.

Uniform response: { items, total, page, page_size } + has_more.

parameters.name: prefix

schema.description: folder prefix ('' for root)
schema.title: Prefix

parameters.description: folder prefix ('' for root)

post.summary: Resolve a full folder chain and prefetch its contents
post.description:
Resolve an entry path by hydrating every folder segment leading to it.

The resolver fetches the immediate subfolders and a page of files for each segment in the chain. It also can prefetch parts around a target sequence.

get.summary: Fetch metadata for a raw entry
get.description: Return the stored metadata for a raw entry located in the container tree.

404.description: Entry not found in the index.

get.description: Return raw files that are done, non-duplicate and have indexed lines.

schema.title: Response List Raw Files Raw Files Get

post.summary: Generate a download URL for a raw file
post.description:
Return a short-lived pre-signed URL that allows downloading a raw file. Either provide the `sha256_original` hash directly or specify both `container_id` and `entry_path` so the hash can be resolved.

You can pass parameters either as query string or in the JSON body. If both are provided, the JSON body values take precedence.

schema.description:
Optional JSON body with `sha256_original`, `container_id`, `entry_path`, `expires_in`.
Example: {"sha256_original": "...", "container_id": 123, "entry_path": "path/to/file", "expires_in": 900}
schema.title: Payload

402.description: Insufficient GB quota to unlock the file.

get.summary: Preview unlock cost for a raw file
get.description: Return the quota impact of unlocking a raw file. Either provide `sha256_original` or the tuple (`container_id`, `entry_path`).

post.summary: Preview the points cost of a raw export
post.description: Return an upper bound estimate of how many raw parts would be processed by a raw export and how many points this would consume.

403.description: Subscription does not allow raw exports.

post.summary: Queue a raw export job
post.description: Queue an asynchronous export job for raw search results. Mode 'rows' exports a CSV of matching lines, mode 'parts' exports a text snapshot of matching parts.

403.description: Subscription does not allow raw exports.

500.description: Error while creating the export job.

get.description: Return the profile of the authenticated user.

401.description: Unauthorized. Invalid or missing authentication token.

429.description: Too many requests: rate limit exceeded.

patch.description:
Update the authenticated user's profile with fields defined by `ProfileUpdate`. If `email` is changed, uniqueness is enforced.

**Behavior**
- Only whitelisted fields from `ProfileUpdate` are applied.
- If the new email already exists, the request fails with 409.

**Response**
Returns the updated profile.

401.description: Unauthorized. Invalid or missing authentication token.

429.description: Too many requests: rate limit exceeded.

get.description:
Return a paginated list of unlocked leaks for the authenticated account.

Pagination
- `page` starts at 1.
- `page_size` is 1 to 1000 (default 100).

Filtering
- `search` optional free-text filter applied to URL or username.
- `is_email` optional boolean: `true` emails only, `false` usernames only, `null` both.
- `list_id` optional integer: filter leaks assigned to this list.
- `list_none` optional boolean: filter leaks with no list assignment.

Response semantics
- When no filter is provided at all (no `search`, no `is_email`, no list filter), `total` equals your global count of unlocked items.
- When any filter is provided (including only `is_email`), `total` equals the filtered count, while `total_unlocked` remains your global total.

Errors
- 404 Page out of range when the offset exceeds the corresponding total.

parameters.name: is_email

schema.description: true=email, false=username
schema.title: Is Email

parameters.description: true=email, false=username

parameters.name: list_none

schema.description: Only leaks without a list when true
schema.title: List None

parameters.description: Only leaks without a list when true

get.summary: List your unlocked leaks with advanced filters
get.description:
Return a paginated list of your unlocked leaks filtered by the same fields supported by `LeakSearchFilters`. Filters are passed as query parameters. Optional `search` can further narrow results.

Pagination
- `page` starts at 1.
- `page_size` is 1 to 1000 (default 100).

Filtering
- Any combination of `LeakSearchFilters` fields.
- `search` optional free-text filter applied to URL or username.
- `list_id` optional integer: filter leaks assigned to this list.
- `list_none` optional boolean: filter leaks with no list assignment.

Response semantics
- `total` and `total_unlocked` both equal the number of unlocked items matching the filters.

post.summary: Export your unlocked leaks to CSV/TXT/JSON
post.description:
Queue an export of your unlocked leaks with optional filters. The job runs asynchronously and the file will appear in the Exports section when ready.

Body (JSON)
- `search` optional free-text filter applied to URL or username.
- `is_email` optional boolean: `true` emails only, `false` usernames only, `null` both.
- `list_id` optional list id filter.
- `list_none` optional boolean to only include leaks without list.
- `unlocked_at_min` optional ISO 8601 timestamp (with timezone) to include items unlocked at or after this instant.

Query parameters
- `format` optional output format: `csv` (default), `txt`, or `json`.

Limits
- You can have at most 5 exports with status PENDING or IN_PROGRESS.

Response
`ExportResponse` with `status`, `message`, and `export_id`.

parameters.name: format

schema.description: Output format: csv (default), txt, or json.

parameters.description: Output format: csv (default), txt, or json.

post.summary: Export your unlocked leaks to CSV/TXT/JSON (advanced filters)
post.description:
Queue an export of your unlocked leaks filtered by the same fields supported by `LeakSearchFilters`. Provide advanced filters in the JSON request body. The job runs asynchronously and the file will appear in the Exports section when ready.

Request body
- JSON payload following the `LeakSearchFilters` schema.

Query parameters
- `unlocked_at_min` optional ISO 8601 timestamp with timezone to include items unlocked at or after this instant.
- `list_id` optional list id filter.
- `list_none` optional boolean to only include leaks without list.
- `format` optional output format: `csv` (default), `txt`, or `json`.

Limits
- At least one advanced filter is required.
- You can have at most 5 exports with status PENDING or IN_PROGRESS.

Response
`ExportResponse` with `status`, `message`, and `export_id`.

parameters.name: list_id

schema.description: Filter by list id
schema.title: List Id

parameters.description: Filter by list id

parameters.name: list_none

schema.description: Only leaks without list
schema.title: List None

parameters.description: Only leaks without list

parameters.name: format

schema.description: Output format: csv (default), txt, or json.

parameters.description: Output format: csv (default), txt, or json.

get.description:
Return all your Unlocked Lists in ascending creation order.

Parameters
- `with_counts` when true, each list includes `items_count`, the number of unlocked leaks currently assigned to that list. When false, `items_count` is returned as 0 to avoid extra computation.

Errors
- Standard 401 when not authenticated.

parameters.name: with_counts

schema.description: When true, include `items_count` per list.
schema.title: With Counts

parameters.description: When true, include `items_count` per list.

schema.title: Response List Unlocked Lists Profile Unlocked Lists Get

post.summary: Create an Unlocked List
post.description:
Create a new list to organize your unlocked leaks.

Rules
- Maximum number of lists is determined by your current plan.
- List names must be unique per account, case-insensitive.

Response
- Returns the created list. `items_count` is 0 at creation time.

Errors
- 400 when the user already has the maximum number of lists.
- 400 when the user has no plan.
- 409 when a list with the same name already exists.

schema.description: JSON payload with `name` (required) and `color` (optional UI attribute).

patch.description:
Update list metadata. Only provided fields are updated.

Updatable fields
- `name` must be unique per account, case-insensitive.
- `color` optional UI attribute.

Errors
- 404 when the list does not exist or is not owned by the account.
- 409 when the new name collides with another list.

parameters.name: list_id

schema.description: ID of the list to update
schema.title: List Id

parameters.description: ID of the list to update

schema.description: JSON payload with optional `name` and optional `color`.

delete.description:
Delete the list and start a background cleanup of related leak assignments.

Behavior
- The list is removed immediately.
- Any unlocked leak that referenced this list will be cleaned up by a background task.
- The response includes a `task_id` that you can poll at `/profile/unlocked/list-tasks/{task_id}`.

Errors
- 404 when the list does not exist or is not owned by the account.

parameters.name: list_id

schema.description: ID of the list to delete
schema.title: List Id

parameters.description: ID of the list to delete

post.summary: Clear list assignment from leaks while keeping the list
post.description: Remove the list assignment from all unlocked leaks that currently reference this list. The list itself is kept. The operation runs in the background and returns a `task_id`.

parameters.name: list_id

schema.description: ID of the list whose assignments will be cleared
schema.title: List Id

parameters.description: ID of the list whose assignments will be cleared

get.summary: Get unlocked lists background task status
get.description:
Return the status of a background task started by unlocked lists operations.

This endpoint is only for tasks created by:
- `POST /profile/unlocked/lists/bulk-assign` (bulk assign/unassign list)

Usage
- Use the exact `task_id` returned by one of these endpoints.

Important
- Do **not** use this endpoint for unlock tasks created by `/search/.../unlock/task`. For unlock tasks, poll `/tasks/{task_id}` instead.

put.summary: Assign or unassign a list for one unlocked leak
put.description:
Assign a specific list to a single unlocked leak, or unassign it.

Behavior
- Provide `list_id` to assign. Use `null` to remove the assignment.

Errors
- 404 when the leak does not exist for the account or the list is not found.

parameters.name: leak_id

schema.description: Unlocked leak identifier
schema.title: Leak Id

parameters.description: Unlocked leak identifier

schema.description: JSON payload with `list_id` to assign. Use null to unassign.

put.summary: Create or update a comment for one unlocked leak
put.description:
Create or update a user comment on a single unlocked leak. Empty or whitespace-only comments are treated as delete.

Limits
- Max 500 characters.

Errors
- 404 when the leak does not exist for the account.
- 422 when the comment exceeds 500 characters.

parameters.name: leak_id

schema.description: Unlocked leak identifier
schema.title: Leak Id

parameters.description: Unlocked leak identifier

schema.description: JSON payload with a single `comment` field. Empty string removes the comment.

delete.summary: Delete the comment of one unlocked leak
delete.description:
Delete the user comment attached to a specific unlocked leak.

Errors
- 404 when the leak does not exist for the account.

parameters.name: leak_id

schema.description: Unlocked leak identifier
schema.title: Leak Id

parameters.description: Unlocked leak identifier

post.summary: Bulk assign or unassign a list across many unlocked leaks
post.description:
Start a background task that assigns a target list to all unlocked leaks matching the provided filters. Use a null `target_list_id` to remove the assignment for matches.

Filtering
- Supports the same filtering fields used by the advanced unlocked search API.
- Optional helpers: `search`, `is_email`, `list_id_filter`, `list_none`.

Validation
- `target_list_id` must be a positive integer when provided. Use null to unassign.

Response
- Returns a `task_id` that you can poll with `/profile/unlocked/list-tasks/{task_id}`.

schema.description: JSON payload with `target_list_id` (int or null) and optional filter fields to select which unlocked leaks will be updated. Filter shape matches the advanced unlocked search API.

post.summary: Download a raw file through the platform

307.description: Temporary redirect to a presigned URL for the raw file.

404.description: Download not found or raw file unavailable.

410.description: Download expired or previous attempt failed. Unlock the file again to regenerate access.

post.summary: Create Invitation
Resend Invitation
Revoke Invitation

get.description: Return the cached service statistics snapshot. If stats are not available in cache, the endpoint returns `{ "message": "Stats not available" }`.

post.summary: Unlock selected leaks by ID
post.description:
Unlock leaks by their IDs for the authenticated account if they have enough points.

**Request body**
- `leak_ids` array of leak IDs to unlock (max 10,000). Duplicates are ignored while preserving order.

**Behavior**
- Requires an active paid subscription.
- 1 point per leak. Points are charged up front and partially refunded if some items were already unlocked during processing.
- Only found leaks are processed. If none are found, the request fails.
- The response reflects the final unlocked state from the account-level index.

**Visibility**
- `id` is included only for paid users.
- Credentials are included only for items with `unlocked=true`.

**Errors**
- 400 No leak IDs provided, too many leak IDs, insufficient points, or all selected data already unlocked.
- 401 Unauthorized.
- 403 Forbidden: subscription does not allow unlocking.
- 404 No valid leaks found.
- 422 Validation error.

403.description: Forbidden. The user's subscription does not allow unlocking data.

404.description: Not found. No valid leaks were found.

get.description:
Return the current account's export jobs ordered by most recent first. Supports pagination.

**Pagination**
- `page` starts at 1.
- `page_size` default and maximum are defined by server settings (default 20, max 100 if not configured).

**Response**
`PaginatedResponse[ExportBase]` with `items`, `total`, `page`, `page_size`.

**Errors**
- 404 Page out of range when the offset exceeds the total.

parameters.name: page

schema.description: Page number starting at 1
schema.title: Page

parameters.description: Page number starting at 1

parameters.name: page_size

schema.description: Number of items per page
schema.title: Page Size

parameters.description: Number of items per page

401.description: Unauthorized. The user is not authenticated.

429.description: Too many requests: rate limit exceeded.

get.description:
Return all notification methods configured for the current account.

Method types
- `email`
- `slack` (Incoming Webhook URL)
- `telegram` (`value` = bot token, `second_value` = chat_id)
- `webhook` (generic HTTP webhook)

Response
Array of objects with `id`, `type`, `value`, `second_value`, `timestamp`.

schema.title: Response List Notification Methods Notification Methods Get

post.summary: Create notification method
post.description:
Create a new notification method for the current account.

Body fields
- `type` one of: `email`, `slack`, `telegram`, `webhook`.
- `value` string. For Slack use the incoming webhook URL. For Telegram use the bot token.
- `second_value` optional. Required for Telegram (`chat_id`).

Response
Object with `id`, `type`, `value`, `second_value`, `timestamp`.

patch.description:
Update an existing notification method owned by the current account.

Errors
- 404 Notification method not found.

delete.description:
Delete a notification method owned by the current account.

Errors
- 404 Notification method not found.
- 409 Method in use by notifications.

get.description:
Return all notifications configured for the current account, including linked method info.

Response
Array of objects with fields like `id`, `method_id`, `type`, `second_type`, `value`, `filters`, `is_active`, `timestamp`, `method_type`, `method_value`, `auto_unlock`, `max_points`, `daily_spent`, `daily_reset_at`, `total_notifications`, `total_cost`.

post.summary: Create notification
post.description:
Create a new notification bound to an existing notification method.

Supported types
- `email` requires `value` (email). `second_type` is not allowed.
- `domain` requires `value` (domain). `second_type` optional: one of domain leak types, default `ALL`.
- `metadata` requires `filters` (no `value`). Bulk is not allowed.
- `advanced` requires `filters` (no `value`). Bulk is not allowed.

Bulk creation
- For `email` and `domain`, set `bulk=true` and provide newline-separated values in `value` to create several notifications at once.

Limit
- Max notifications = plan.monitoring_limit (si abonnement actif) + extra_monitoring_limit (assets) pour le compte.

patch.description: Update an existing notification owned by the current account. All type-specific rules from creation apply.

delete.description: Delete a single notification owned by the current account.

Delete multiple notifications owned by the current account.

Body
- `ids` array of notification IDs to delete.

patch.description: Enable or disable a notification by ID.

schema.title: Response Set Notification Active Notifications  Notification Id  Active Patch

post.summary: Test notification method
post.description:
Validate that the provided parameters allow sending a test notification.

Slack: Incoming Webhook URL. Telegram: `value`=bot token, `second_value`=chat_id. Webhook: sends a JSON payload to the provided URL.

get.description: Return monitored assets usage and limits (plan + extra assets) at account level.

Return paginated notification runs for the current user ordered by most recent first.

**Pagination**
- `page` starts at 1.
- `page_size` is 1 to 1000 (default 20).

**Response**
`PaginatedResponse[NotificationRunBase]` with `items`, `total`, `page`, `page_size`.

get.summary: List leaks for a notification run
get.description:
Return leaks associated with a specific notification run. Optional `search` and `is_email` filters apply to the result set.

**Pagination**
- `page` starts at 1.
- `page_size` is 1 to 1000 (default 100).

**Access and visibility**
- Visibility of full URLs and IDs depends on the notification type and your plan capabilities.
- Credentials are included only for items with `unlocked=true`.

**Response**
`PaginatedLeaksResponse` with `items`, `total`, `total_unlocked`, `page`, `page_size`.

**Errors**
- 404 Run not found.

post.summary: Unlock leaks from a notification run
post.description:
Unlock leaks that belong to a specific notification run. You can optionally filter by `search` and `is_email`, and cap the number of new unlocks with `max`. The effective limit is capped by your available points.

**Behavior**
- Only items not previously unlocked in this run are attempted.
- Points are charged only for newly unlocked items.
- The response contains the final unlocked state for the requested IDs.

**Errors**
- 400 No leaks for this run, all data already unlocked, or no data matches the search.
- 404 Run not found.

schema.title: Response Unlock Notification Run Leaks Notification Runs  Run Id  Leaks Unlock Post

get.summary: Export leaks from a notification run to CSV/TXT/JSON
get.description:
Queue an export of leaks associated with a specific notification run. Optional `search` and `is_email` filters apply. The job runs asynchronously and the file will appear in the Exports section when ready.

**Limits**
- You can have at most 5 exports with status PENDING or IN_PROGRESS.

**Query parameters**
- `format` optional output format: `csv` (default), `txt`, or `json`.

**Response**
`ExportResponse` with `status`, `message`, and `export_id`.

**Errors**
- 404 Run not found.
- 400 Too many exports in progress.

parameters.name: format

schema.description: Output format: csv (default), txt, or json.

parameters.description: Output format: csv (default), txt, or json.

get.description:
Return the live status for a background task started by list operations Use the `task_id` returned by the create endpoint.

**Usage**
Poll this endpoint every 1s until `completed=true`. If the task is unknown or expired, the service returns `completed=true` with no totals, which can be treated as finished.

items.title: Items
items.description: Entries located under the requested prefix.

page_size.title: Page Size
page_size.description: Maximum number of entries returned in this response.

container_id.title: Container Id
container_id.description: Identifier of the container that was browsed.

prefix.title: Prefix
prefix.description: Folder prefix used for the listing.

expires_in.title: Expires In
expires_in.description: Number of seconds before the pre-signed URL expires.

file_name.title: File Name
file_name.description: Suggested file name for the downloaded file.

size_bytes.title: Size Bytes
size_bytes.description: Size of the file in bytes, when known.

mime.title: Mime
mime.description: MIME type of the file, when available.

already_unlocked.title: Already Unlocked
already_unlocked.description: True when the user had an active unlock for the file prior to this request.

downloaded_before.title: Downloaded Before
downloaded_before.description: Indicates whether the user has successfully downloaded this file in the past.

is_email.title: Is Email
is_email.description: Identifier type filter: true=email only, false=username only, null=both.

url_domain_not.title: Url Domain Not
url_domain_not.description: Exclude URL domains containing these values.

url_host_not.title: Url Host Not
url_host_not.description: Exclude URL hosts containing these values.

is_email.title: Is Email
is_email.description: Identifier type filter: true=email only, false=username only, null=both.

email_domain_not.title: Email Domain Not
email_domain_not.description: Exclude email domains containing these values.

email_host_not.title: Email Host Not
email_host_not.description: Exclude email hosts containing these values.

password_strength.title: Password Strength
password_strength.description: Password strength category: too_weak, weak, medium, strong.

added_from.title: Added From
added_from.description: Only include leaks indexed on/after this UTC datetime.

added_to.title: Added To
added_to.description: Only include leaks indexed on/before this UTC datetime.

force_and.title: Force And
force_and.description: When true, require all values within each field (AND within field).

title_not.title: Title Not
title_not.description: Exclude page titles containing these values.

body_text_not.title: Body Text Not
body_text_not.description: Exclude body text containing these values.

meta_description_not.title: Meta Description Not
meta_description_not.description: Exclude meta descriptions containing these values.

added_from.title: Added From
added_from.description: Only include pages indexed on/after this UTC datetime.

added_to.title: Added To
added_to.description: Only include pages indexed on/before this UTC datetime.

force_and.title: Force And
force_and.description: When true, values within the same field are ANDed instead of ORed.

value.title: Value
value.description: Value to monitor (required for EMAIL/DOMAIN types).

auto_unlock.title: Auto Unlock
auto_unlock.description: If true, automatically unlock new matching leaks (consumes points).

max_points.title: Max Points
max_points.description: Daily points cap for auto-unlock (if enabled).

second_type.description: For DOMAIN notifications: which leak category to monitor.

bulk.title: Bulk
bulk.description: Create multiple notifications at once (e.g., newline-separated values).

value.title: Value
value.description: Primary value (e.g., webhook URL, bot token, or email address).

second_value.title: Second Value
second_value.description: Secondary value when required by the method (e.g., Telegram chat_id).

headers.title: Headers
headers.description: Optional custom HTTP headers for webhook methods (max 10).

container_id.title: Container Id
container_id.description: Identifier of the container that owns the part.

entry_path.title: Entry Path
entry_path.description: Entry path that contains the part.

offset.title: Offset
offset.description: Byte offset of the part inside the entry.

size_bytes.title: Size Bytes
size_bytes.description: Size of the returned block in bytes, if available.

ingested_at.title: Ingested At
ingested_at.description: ISO timestamp of the ingestion time for the block.

trim_overlap.title: Trim Overlap
trim_overlap.description: True if the overlapping prefix was trimmed from the returned content.

overlap_chars.title: Overlap Chars
overlap_chars.description: Number of characters trimmed from the start when `trim_overlap=true`.

text.title: Text
text.description: Text content of the block. May be censored.

censored.title: Censored
censored.description: True if the user has not unlocked the content and it was redacted.

seq.title: Seq
seq.description: Sequential part number within the entry.

size_bytes.title: Size Bytes
size_bytes.description: Size of the block in bytes, when recorded.

offset.title: Offset
offset.description: Byte offset of the block within the entry.

ingested_at.title: Ingested At
ingested_at.description: ISO timestamp of the ingestion time for the block.

items.title: Items
items.description: Sequence of parts found for the requested slice.

total.title: Total
total.description: Total number of parts available for the entry.

page_size.title: Page Size
page_size.description: Number of parts returned in this page.

window.description: Span of part indexes covered by the response.

entry_path.title: Entry Path
entry_path.description: Entry path for which the parts are listed.

start_index.title: Start Index
start_index.description: Index (0-based) of the first part present in the window.

end_index.title: End Index
end_index.description: Index (0-based) of the last part present in the window.

sha256_original.title: Sha256 Original
sha256_original.description: SHA-256 hash of the raw file that would be downloaded.

raw_file_id.title: Raw File Id
raw_file_id.description: Internal identifier of the raw file record.

file_name.title: File Name
file_name.description: Proposed download file name, when available.

original_file_name.title: Original File Name
original_file_name.description: Original file name when it differs from the stored name.

already_unlocked.title: Already Unlocked
already_unlocked.description: Whether the user has already unlocked the complete file.

cost_bytes.title: Cost Bytes
cost_bytes.description: Number of bytes that will be debited if the user unlocks the file.

user_gb_available_bytes.title: User Gb Available Bytes
user_gb_available_bytes.description: Remaining quota in bytes for the current user.

can_unlock.title: Can Unlock
can_unlock.description: True when the user has enough quota to unlock the file.

file_password.title: File Password
file_password.description: Password required to open the downloaded archive, when present.

downloaded_before.title: Downloaded Before
downloaded_before.description: True if the user has downloaded this file previously, regardless of unlock expiration.

original_file_name.title: Original File Name
original_file_name.description: Original file name attached to the raw file.

lines.title: Lines
lines.description: Number of lines indexed for the raw file.

ingested_at.title: Ingested At
ingested_at.description: ISO timestamp indicating when the raw file was ingested.

container_id.title: Container Id
container_id.description: Identifier of the container that owns the entry.

entry_path.title: Entry Path
entry_path.description: Entry path looked up in the index.

entry_name.title: Entry Name
entry_name.description: Base name of the entry, when known.

size_bytes.title: Size Bytes
size_bytes.description: Size of the entry in bytes, if provided by the index.

sha256_original.title: Sha256 Original
sha256_original.description: SHA-256 hash of the original raw file, when known.

container_id.title: Container Id
container_id.description: Identifier of the container that stores the raw entry.

entry_path.title: Entry Path
entry_path.description: Path of the entry inside the container.

entry_name.title: Entry Name
entry_name.description: Base file name extracted from the path, when available.

ext.title: Ext
ext.description: Detected file extension for the entry.

seq.title: Seq
seq.description: Sequential block number within the entry.

offset.title: Offset
offset.description: Byte offset of the block within the original file.

ingested_at.title: Ingested At
ingested_at.description: ISO timestamp of the ingestion time.

sha256_original.title: Sha256 Original
sha256_original.description: SHA-256 hash of the original raw file, when known.

already_unlocked.title: Already Unlocked
already_unlocked.description: Indicates if the user has already unlocked this block or the parent file.

matching_lines.title: Matching Lines
matching_lines.description: Lines from the block content that contain the queried text (export only).

q.title: Q
q.description: Optional full text query to match within raw blocks. Quotes are ignored for the length check. When omitted or empty, you must provide at least one filter among container_id, exts, categories, file_name.

container_id.title: Container Id
container_id.description: Restrict the search to a specific container id.

exts.title: Exts
exts.description: List of file extensions to include (case-insensitive, without leading dot).

exts_not.title: Exts Not
exts_not.description: List of file extensions to exclude (case-insensitive, without leading dot).

categories.title: Categories
categories.description: Filter results by raw file category. Applied after the ElasticSearch query.

categories_not.title: Categories Not
categories_not.description: Exclude these raw file categories. Applied after the ElasticSearch query.

file_name.title: File Name
file_name.description: Case-insensitive wildcard that must match the entry name.

file_name_not.title: File Name Not
file_name_not.description: Case-insensitive wildcard that must NOT match the entry name.

total.title: Total
total.description: Total number of results that match the query.

page_size.title: Page Size
page_size.description: Maximum number of items returned in this page.

items.title: Items
items.description: Entries included in the prefetched slice.

total.title: Total
total.description: Total number of entries reported for the segment.

page.title: Page
page.description: Page index of the prefetched slice.

page_size.title: Page Size
page_size.description: Maximum number of entries returned in the slice.

prefetch_files.title: Prefetch Files
prefetch_files.description: Whether the resolver should prefetch the first page of files for each segment.

max_subfolders.title: Max Subfolders
max_subfolders.description: Maximum number of subfolders to fetch per segment.

file_page_size.title: File Page Size
file_page_size.description: Page size used when prefetching files for each segment.

prefetch_parts.description: Optional window of parts to prefetch for the resolved file.

seq.title: Seq
seq.description: Sequence number to centre the prefetched window around.

limit.title: Limit
limit.description: Number of parts to retrieve around the target sequence.

container_id.title: Container Id
container_id.description: Identifier of the container that owns the entry.

entry_path.title: Entry Path
entry_path.description: Entry path to resolve from the root of the container.

container_id.title: Container Id
container_id.description: Identifier of the container that owns the resolved path.

entry_path.title: Entry Path
entry_path.description: Entry path requested by the caller.

segments.title: Segments
segments.description: Ordered list of segments composing the folder chain.

target_entry.description: Entry metadata for the resolved file when found.

target_parts.description: Prefetched parts for the resolved file when requested.

prefix.title: Prefix
prefix.description: Folder prefix represented by this segment.

subfolders.title: Subfolders
subfolders.description: Immediate subfolders available under the prefix.

subfolders_truncated.title: Subfolders Truncated
subfolders_truncated.description: True when more subfolders are available beyond the prefetched slice.

files.description: Prefetched file entries located in this prefix when available.

items.title: Items
items.description: List of immediate subfolders found below the prefix.

total.title: Total
total.description: Total count of distinct immediate subfolders estimated precisely.

page_size.title: Page Size
page_size.description: Page size used for the listing.

has_more.title: Has More
has_more.description: True if there are more subfolders beyond this page.

container_id.title: Container Id
container_id.description: Identifier of the container that was browsed.

prefix.title: Prefix
prefix.description: Folder prefix used for the aggregation.

entry_name.title: Entry Name
entry_name.description: Base name of the entry, when present.

size_bytes.title: Size Bytes
size_bytes.description: Size of the entry in bytes, when known.

leak_ids.title: Leak Ids
leak_ids.description: List of leak document IDs to unlock.

target_list_id.title: Target List Id
target_list_id.description: Optional list id to assign to newly unlocked items.
